snippet: Gibbs introduced the Aquada, an amphibious three-seat sports car, in 2003. The Aquada was said to be capable of speeds faster than 100 m.p.h. on pavement and 30 m.p.h. in the water.
abstract: Gibbs Aquada, amphibious three-seat sports car, was introduced as ready for market in 2003, but program was shut down in 2004 when availability of Land Rover Engine used in car was cast into doubt; Gibbs says project is scuttled until new engine supplier is found.
lead_paragraph: Gibbs introduced the Aquada, an amphibious three-seat sports car, in 2003. The Aquada was said to be capable of speeds faster than 100 m.p.h. on pavement and 30 m.p.h. in the water.

headline.seo: Amphibious Car Is Still Waiting to Catch a Wave
headline.main: Amphibious Car Is Still Waiting to Catch a Wave
headline.print_headline: Amphibious Car Is Still Waiting To Catch a Wave
